title: Why do some objects move continuously while some moving objects stop suddenly? - Quora

response.answer_text: Because of friction.  Friction is a force that acts in the opposite direction to the motion. Here’s a little experiment that you can do right now:Take a pen and push it on a carpet,calculate the distance it moved.Then do the same thing on a flat surface like a table or floor.You’ll notice that the pen moves further on a smooth surface rather than on a rough one,because there is less friction there. Now do the same thing with a smooth glass.Again you’ll notice that when a smooth object moves through a smooth surface there is less friction(object moves further without stopping) than when a rough object moves through a smooth surface. This is all considering that there’s no other force acting on an object.Newton’s First Law states: An object will remain at rest or in uniform motion in a straight line unless acted upon by an external force (Newton's Laws) So to answer your question: The reason why some objects move for a longer period of time than others is because of a force known as friction. Fun fact: If you throw a ball in space it’ll (probably) move on forever if not affected by planet’s and star’s gravity. Any corrections and suggestions are more than welcomed.

Some moving objects encounter opposition to their movement… the opposition can be quite strong and abrupt. For details, I would need an example.
